Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Patient-Controlled Epidural Analgesia vs. Continuous Epidural Analgesia in Surgical Patients

Intervention.evidence: comparing PCEA and CEA in adult surgical patients

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was pain scores on postoperative day one (POD1).

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 480 participants were randomised across six RCTs.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Two studies reported significantly reduced resting pain scores on POD1 with PCEA (36–44% reduction, p < 0.05).

Harms.evidence: Nausea and vomiting were less frequent with PCEA (p = 0.01).

Trial_Registration.evidence: The review was registered with PROSPERO (CRD42018106644).
